t: Whoever*pn dwells in the shelter of the Most High will*ld rest in the shadow of the Almighty.
I*ln will say of the Lord,*s “He is my refuge and my fortress, my*ld God, in whom I trust.”
Surely*pn he will save you from*ld the fowler’s snare and*ld from the deadly pestilence.
He*ln will cover you with his feathers, and*ld under his wings you will find refuge; his*ld faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
You*ln will not fear the terror of night, nor*ld the arrow that flies by day,
nor*ln the pestilence that stalks in the darkness, nor*ld the plague that destroys at midday.
A*ln thousand may fall at your side, ten*ld thousand at your right hand, but*ld it will not come near you.
You*ln will only observe with your eyes and*ld see the punishment of the wicked.
If*pn you say, “The Lord*s is my refuge,” and*ld you make the Most High your dwelling,
no*ln harm will overtake you, no*ld disaster will come near your tent.
For*ln he will command his angels concerning you to*ld guard you in all your ways;
they*ln will lift you up in their hands, so*ld that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
You*ln will tread on the lion and the cobra; you*ld will trample the great lion and the serpent.
“Because*pn he loves me,” says the Lord,*s “I will rescue him; I*ld will protect him, for he acknowledges my name.
He*ln will call on me, and I will answer him; I*ld will be with him in trouble, I*ld will deliver him and honor him.
With*ln long life I will satisfy him and*ld show him my salvation.”
